SEARCH
Package toolsBySp

Class InputUtils

java.lang.Object
toolsBySp.InputUtils
public class InputUtils extends Object
A utility class for getting various types of user input with error handling.
Author:
Samuel Pestana

      public InputUtils()

  • Method Details

    • askForInt

      public int askForInt()
      Prompts the user for an integer input and returns the result. If the input is invalid, returns -1.
      Returns:
      the integer entered by the user or -1 if invalid.

    • askForInteger

      public Integer askForInteger()
      Prompts the user for an integer input and returns the result. If the input is invalid, returns null.
      Returns:
      the integer entered by the user or null if invalid.

    • askForFloat

      public float askForFloat()
      Prompts the user for a float input and returns the result. If the input is invalid, returns -1.
      Returns:
      the float entered by the user or -1 if invalid.

    • askForDouble

      public Double askForDouble()
      Prompts the user for a double input and returns the result. If the input is invalid, returns null.
      Returns:
      the double entered by the user or null if invalid.

    • askForString

      public String askForString()
      Prompts the user for a string input and returns the result. If the input is invalid, returns null.
      Returns:
      the string entered by the user or null if invalid.

    • askForBoolean

      public Boolean askForBoolean()
      Prompts the user for a boolean input and returns the result. The input can be "true", "yes", or "1" for true, and "false", "no", or "0" for false. If the input is invalid, returns null.
      Returns:
      the boolean value entered by the user or null if invalid.

    • askForBooleanEs

      public Boolean askForBooleanEs()
      Prompts the user for a boolean input (in Spanish) and returns the result. The input can be "true", "si", or "1" for true, and "false", "no", or "0" for false. If the input is invalid, returns null.
      Returns:
      the boolean value entered by the user or null if invalid.

    • askForDate

      public String askForDate()
      Prompts the user for a date input in the format YYYY-MM-DD. If the input is invalid, returns null.
      Returns:
      the date entered by the user in the format YYYY-MM-DD or null if invalid.

    • formatDate

      public String formatDate(LocalDate date, String pattern)
      Formats the given LocalDate into a string according to the provided pattern. The method uses the DateTimeFormatter to format the date into a human-readable string based on the specified pattern.
      Parameters:
      date - The LocalDate object to be formatted.
      pattern - The pattern to be used for formatting the date (e.g., "yyyy-MM-dd", "dd/MM/yyyy").
      Returns:
      A string representing the formatted date.

    • askForEmail

      public String askForEmail()
      Prompts the user to enter an email address and validates the format. If the email format is valid, it returns the email. Otherwise, it returns null.
      Returns:
      a valid email address if the input is correct, or null if the format is invalid.

    • askForPhoneNumberFlexible

      public String askForPhoneNumberFlexible()
      Prompts the user to input a phone number and validates it with a flexible format (international with separators). The method validates the phone number using a regular expression, allowing an optional country code and ensuring the number contains between 10 and 15 digits.
      Returns:
      the valid phone number entered by the user, or null if the input is invalid

    • askForPhoneNumberStrict

      public String askForPhoneNumberStrict()
      Prompts the user to input a phone number and validates it using only digits (strict validation). This method ensures that the number consists of digits only, without any separators or country codes.
      Returns:
      the valid phone number entered by the user, or null if the input is invalid

    • askForISBN

      public String askForISBN()
      Prompts the user to input an ISBN and validates it. The method supports both ISBN-10 and ISBN-13 formats and checks if the ISBN is valid based on the format and checksum.
      Returns:
      the valid ISBN entered by the user, or null if the input is invalid

    • askForCreditCard

      public String askForCreditCard()
      Asks the user for a credit card number, validates its format (15 or 16 digits), and checks its validity using the Luhn algorithm.
      Returns:
      the valid credit card number if it matches the required format and checksum, otherwise returns null.
